SEARCH
Package grafioschtrader.repository

Interface CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom

All Superinterfaces:
BaseRepositoryCustom<Currencypair>, ISecuritycurrencyService<Currencypair>
All Known Subinterfaces:
CurrencypairJpaRepository
All Known Implementing Classes:
CurrencypairJpaRepositoryImpl
public interface CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom extends ISecuritycurrencyService<Currencypair>
Custom repository methods for the Currencypair entity. Extends ISecuritycurrencyService to provide common functionality for security and currency pair entities.

  • Method Details

    • catchAllUpCurrencypairHistoryquote

      List<Currencypair> catchAllUpCurrencypairHistoryquote()
      Fetches and updates the historical end-of-day price data for all currency pairs from their respective data providers up to the most recent trading day.
      Returns:
      A list of Currencypair entities for which the history was updated.

    • allCurrenciesFillEmptyDaysInHistoryquote

      void allCurrenciesFillEmptyDaysInHistoryquote()
      For currency pairs, historical end-of-day rates must be available for each day. Otherwise GT cannot calculate the transactions on weekends and holidays. This method, which fills these gaps should be performed daily.

    • currencieyFillEmptyDaysInHistoryquote

      void currencieyFillEmptyDaysInHistoryquote(Currencypair currencypair) throws Exception
      Fills any missing historical end-of-day price data for a specific currency pair. This is crucial for ensuring continuous data, especially for calculations involving weekends and holidays.
      Parameters:
      currencypair - The Currencypair to process.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the data filling process.

    • fillEmptyCurrencypair

      void fillEmptyCurrencypair(Integer idSecuritycurrency)
      Fills any missing historical end-of-day price data for a currency pair identified by its ID.
      Parameters:
      idSecuritycurrency - The ID of the Currencypair.

    • getClosePriceForDate

      Double getClosePriceForDate(Currencypair currencypair, Date closeDate)
      Retrieves the closing price for a given currency pair on a specific date.
      Parameters:
      currencypair - The Currencypair for which to get the close price.
      closeDate - The specific date for which the close price is requested.
      Returns:
      The closing price as a Double, or null if not found.

    • updateAllLastPrices

      void updateAllLastPrices()
      Updates the last (most recent) price for all currency pairs from their intraday data providers.

    • updateLastPrice

      Currencypair updateLastPrice(Currencypair currencypair)
      Updates the last (most recent) price of a certain currency pair from its intraday data provider.
      Parameters:
      currencypair - The Currencypair to update.
      Returns:
      The updated Currencypair entity with the new last price.

    • updateLastPriceByList

      List<Currencypair> updateLastPriceByList(List<Currencypair> currencypairs)
      Updates the last (most recent) price of a certain currency pair from its intraday data provider.
      Parameters:
      currencypair - The Currencypair to update.
      Returns:
      The updated Currencypair entity with the new last price.

    • tryUpToDateIntraDataWhenRetryIntraLoadGreaterThan0

      List<Currencypair> tryUpToDateIntraDataWhenRetryIntraLoadGreaterThan0(Integer idTenant, Integer idWatchlist)
      Attempts to update intraday data for currency pairs in a given watchlist for a specific tenant, if their retry intraday load count is greater than 0. The action is normally triggered by the user via the user interface.
      Parameters:
      idTenant - The ID of the tenant. For security reasons.
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist.
      Returns:
      A list of Currencypair entities for which intraday data update was attempted.

    • tryUpToDateHistoricalDataWhenRetryHistoryLoadGreaterThan0

      List<Currencypair> tryUpToDateHistoricalDataWhenRetryHistoryLoadGreaterThan0(Integer idTenant, Integer idWatchlist)
      Attempts to update historical data for currency pairs in a given watchlist for a specific tenant, if their retry historical load count is greater than 0. The action is normally triggered by the user via the user interface.
      Parameters:
      idTenant - The ID of the tenant. For security reasons.
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist.
      Returns:
      A list of Currencypair entities for which historical data update was attempted.

    • createTaskDataChangeOfEmptyHistoryqoute

      void createTaskDataChangeOfEmptyHistoryqoute()
      Creates a background task for each currency pair that does not yet have historical price data. The number of failed attempts must not exceed the retry limit. There is a one-minute interval between the individual jobs created.

    • findOrCreateCurrencypairByFromAndToCurrency

      Currencypair findOrCreateCurrencypairByFromAndToCurrency(String fromCurrency, String toCurrency, boolean loadAsync)
      Finds a currency pair by its 'from' and 'to' currency codes. If it doesn't exist, it will be created.
      Parameters:
      fromCurrency - The 'from' currency code (e.g., "EUR").
      toCurrency - The 'to' currency code (e.g., "USD").
      loadAsync - If true, and the currency pair is created, its historical data will be loaded asynchronously.
      Returns:
      The found or newly created Currencypair.

    • findOrCreateCurrencypairByFromAndToCurrency

      Currencypair findOrCreateCurrencypairByFromAndToCurrency(List<Currencypair> currencypairs, String fromCurrency, String toCurrency)
      Finds a currency pair by its 'from' and 'to' currency codes within a provided list of currency pairs. If not found in the list, it attempts to create a new one (without asynchronous data loading).
      Parameters:
      currencypairs - A list of existing Currencypair to search within first.
      fromCurrency - The 'from' currency code.
      toCurrency - The 'to' currency code.
      Returns:
      The found or newly created Currencypair.

    • calcGainLossBasedOnDateOrNewestPrice

      void calcGainLossBasedOnDateOrNewestPrice(List<CashaccountPositionSummary> securitycurrencyPositionSummary, Date untilDate)
      Calculates gain/loss for a list of cash account positions based on a specified date or the newest price. Of course, the price gains on the securities are also calculated here.
      Parameters:
      untilDate - The date until which to calculate the gain/loss. If null, the newest price is used.
      cashaccountPositionSummary - A list of CashaccountPositionSummary.

    • createNonExistingCurrencypair

      Currencypair createNonExistingCurrencypair(String fromCurrency, String toCurrency, boolean loadAsync)
      Creates a non-existing currency pair defined by 'from' and 'to' currency codes. A currency pair can be created by the system or by the user.
      Parameters:
      fromCurrency - The 'from' currency code.
      toCurrency - The 'to' currency code.
      loadAsync - If true, historical data for the newly created currency pair will be loaded asynchronously.
      Returns:
      The newly created Currencypair.

    • getDataProviderResponseForUser

      String getDataProviderResponseForUser(Integer idSecuritycurrency, boolean isIntraday)
      Retrieves the raw response from the data provider for a currency pair's price data (historical or intraday). This is used when the UI needs to display data provider information that might require backend processing (e.g., API keys).
      Parameters:
      idSecuritycurrency - The ID of the currency pair.
      isIntraday - True if intraday data is requested, false for historical data.
      Returns:
      The raw response string from the data provider.

    • getDataProviderLinkForUser

      String getDataProviderLinkForUser(Integer idSecuritycurrency, boolean isIntraday)
      Gets the direct link to the data provider for a currency pair's price data (historical or intraday) for user display. In the user interface, the user can follow this link to see how the backend receives the external price data.
      Parameters:
      idSecuritycurrency - The ID of the Currencypair.
      isIntraday - True if intraday data is requested, false for historical data.
      Returns:
      The URL string for the data provider.

    • searchByCriteria

      List<Currencypair> searchByCriteria(SecuritycurrencySearch securitycurrencySearch)
      Searches for currency pairs based on the provided search criteria.
      Parameters:
      securitycurrencySearch - The SecuritycurrencySearch criteria.
      Returns:
      A list of Currencypair entities matching the criteria.

    • getCurrencypairForCrossRate

      CrossRateResponse getCurrencypairForCrossRate(CrossRateRequest crossRateRequest)
      Determines the necessary currency pairs required to calculate cross rates for a list of security currencies relative to the tenant’s main currency. The path to each cross currency can include up to three nodes. For example: if the requested currency is USD, the tenant's main currency is CHF, and the security currency is EUR, then the system will look for currency pairs like: CHF/USD (or USD/CHF) and CHF/EUR (or EUR/CHF). If required currency pairs do not already exist in the repository or request, they are looked up and potentially created. The method returns both the currency pairs and their most recent close prices.
      Parameters:
      crossRateRequest - the request containing the security currencies and existing currency pairs
      Returns:
      a CrossRateResponse with all necessary currency pairs and their close prices

    • searchBuilderWithExclusion

      List<Currencypair> searchBuilderWithExclusion(Integer idWatchlist, Integer idCorrelationSet, SecuritycurrencySearch securitycurrencySearch)
      Searches for currency pairs based on criteria, excluding those in a given watchlist or correlation set. It is intended, for example, to expand a correlation set or watch list with additional instruments. Therefore, existing instruments may no longer appear in the selection.
      Parameters:
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist to exclude (can be null).
      idCorrelationSet - The ID of the correlation set to exclude (can be null).
      securitycurrencySearch - The search criteria.
      Returns:
      A list of Currencypair entities matching the criteria.
